DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Surgery Isodose Target Administered Volume Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the administered volume ratio (the relative magnitudes of two quantities) of the prescribed isodose (radiation dose of equal intensity) and target volume dose in radiation surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prescribed isodose (radiation dose of equal intensity) and target volume dose in radiation surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique that delivers radiation directly to the tumor while sparing the healthy tissue. Also called radiation surgery and stereotactic external beam irradiation.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to treat cancer cells that use high energy beams.

Property.preferredDefinition:
A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or
zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.:The goal intended to be attained.:Given.

Concepts.definition: A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Radiation Surgery Administered Volume Ratio Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the administered volume ratio (the relative magnitudes of two quantities) in radiation surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.:The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
